Turned into the most detailed discussion on the future of the BTCTC landscape I’ve had yet. Including what strategies I’m bearish on and why

text:
For perspective,
@smarterwebuk
has delivered +278% BTC Yield in Q3, yet currently trades at 1.6x mNAV (meaning, priced as if we will only deliver +60% BTC Yield forever).  

These 55 BTC were the result of our ATM-style facility running for the last 2 weeks, and only on up days.

These proceeds are nearly 2x what we generated over the prior 2 week period.  The reason: volume picked up - have people been buying the dip?

This ATM-style facility is the base layer of our capital raising strategy & the lifeblood of a healthy BTCTC.  In my personal opinion, after a harsh sector-wide mNAV compression over the last 10 weeks, this is what a vibrant BTCTC looks like. 

On top of this ATM fundraising layer, we also pursue lumpier (and larger) capital raises of equity bookbuilds, Smarter Converts, and other fundraising opportunities.

It's still early days, but we are on a promising path to become the Metaplanet or Strategy for the UK.

[Quoted post by @smarterwebuk: The Smarter Web Company RNS Announcement: Bitcoin Purchase.

Please read the RNS on our website:
investors.smarterwebcompany.…]
